data.title: Grateful Dead Family Discography: Deja Vu
data.text:
Deja Vu

Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young

Initial release : March 1970

Atlantic SD 7200

The first Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young LP. Garcia contributes pedal steel to one track, Teach You Children.

Tracks

Carry On (Stephen Stills)

Teach Your Children (Graham Nash)

Almost Cut My Hair (David Crosby)

Helpless (Neil Young)

Woodstock (Joni Mitchell)

Deja Vu (David Crosby)

Our House (Graham Nash)

4 + 20 (Stephen Stills)

Country Girl (Neil Young)

Whiskey Boot Hill

Down, Down, Down

"Country Girl"

Everybody I Love You (Stephen Stills / Neil Young)

Musicians

David Crosby - guitar, vocals

Graham Nash - guitar, keyboards, vocals

Stephen Stills - bass, guitar, keyboards, vocals

Neil Young - guitar, harmonica, piano, keyboards, vocals

Greg Reeves - bass, percussion

Dallas Taylor - percussion, drums

Guests;

Jerry Garcia - pedal steel (on Teach Your Children)

John Sebastian - mouth harp (on Deja Vu)

Garcia plays only on Teach Your Children on which the following musicians play;

David Crosby - vocals

Graham Nash - guitar, tambourine, vocals

Stephen Stills - guitar, bass, vocals

Jerry Garcia - pedal steel

Dallas Taylor - tambourine

Credits

Production - Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young

Engineer - Bill Halverson

Direction - Elliott Roberts and Associates

Photography - Tom Gundelfinger, Henry Diltz

Art Direction, design - Gary Burden

Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio III, Los Angeles and Wally Heider's Studio C, San Francisco

Notes

Teach Your Children was recorded at Wally Heider's on October 24, 1969.

Related releases

Teach Your Children was released twice in the early 1970s as a single;

Teach Your Children/Carry On, Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young, 1970, Atlantic 2735

Teach Your Children/Woodstock, Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young, 1971, Atlantic OS 13050 (Oldies Series)

Teach your Children has been included on a number of Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young compilations and movie soundtracks;

So Far, Crosby, Stills Nash & Young, 1974, Atlantic 19119

The Wonder Years: Music from the Emmy Award-Winning Show & Its Era, Various Artists, 1989, Atlantic 82032

Crosby, Stills and Nash Box Set, Crosby, Stills & Nash, 1991, Atlantic 82319

Carry On, Crosby, Stills and Nash, 1991, Atlantic 7567-80487-2

Mr. Music (Soundtrack), Various Artists, 1999, Sonic Images 8903

Buy from amazon.com
